title: How to Make a Double Chocolate Mocha Trifle

steps.headline: Spray a rectangular glass baker pan lightly with vegetable oil.
Read and follow the instructions on the back of the brownie box to make the brownies.
Pour the water and the coffee granules into the batter bowl.
steps.description: Dissolve the granules using a whisk. The mixture will turn into a brown, tan-ish pool of water.

steps.headline: Measure out the milk and pudding mixes and pour them into the bowl.
As you add the milk and pudding mix, whisk the mixture until it is smooth and begins to thicken into a light tan-ish cream.
Once you see the mixture thicken, quickly get out the whipped topping and fold it into the bowl using a classic scraper.
steps.description: Mix it thoroughly until the mixture is uniformly tan throughout.

steps.headline: Check on those brownies.
steps.description: If they are done, pull them out and allow them to cool for a little while.

steps.headline: Come back with a bread knife and cut the brownies into one inch cubes.
Get the toffee bars and chop them up using your food chopper.
Get out a regular dessert bowl.
steps.description: Make sure it is at least five inches deep.

steps.headline: Take about one third of the brownie cubes and place them at the bottom of the bowl.
Take the scraper and layer about one third of the whipped mixture on top of the brownies.
Take one third of the chopped toffee bars and layer it on the whipped mixture.
steps.description: Repeat these three steps two more times.

steps.headline: To make sure that this dessert stays fresh, it is advised that you leave it in the bowl, lay plastic wrap over it, and leave it in the fridge.

text: Preheat oven to 350 °F (177 °C).  Spray a rectangular glass baker pan lightly with vegetable oil.  Read and follow the instructions on the back of the brownie box to make the brownies.  Pour the water and the coffee granules into the batter bowl. Dissolve the granules using a whisk. The mixture will turn into a brown, tan-ish pool of water. Measure out the milk and pudding mixes and pour them into the bowl.  As you add the milk and pudding mix, whisk the mixture until it is smooth and begins to thicken into a light tan-ish cream.  Once you see the mixture thicken, quickly get out the whipped topping and fold it into the bowl using a classic scraper. Mix it thoroughly until the mixture is uniformly tan throughout. Check on those brownies. If they are done, pull them out and allow them to cool for a little while. Come back with a bread knife and cut the brownies into one inch cubes.  Get the toffee bars and chop them up using your food chopper.  Get out a regular dessert bowl. Make sure it is at least five inches deep. Take about one third of the brownie cubes and place them at the bottom of the bowl.  Take the scraper and layer about one third of the whipped mixture on top of the brownies.  Take one third of the chopped toffee bars and layer it on the whipped mixture. Repeat these three steps two more times. To make sure that this dessert stays fresh, it is advised that you leave it in the bowl, lay plastic wrap over it, and leave it in the fridge.
